question.text: A sphere of mass m is rolling without sliding along positive x-axis on a rough horizontal surface of coefficient of friction μ . It elastically collides with a wall and then returns. The correct statement of frictional force (f) acting on the sphere is

options.text: <math><mrow>  <mi>f</mi><mo>⁡</mo>  <mo>=</mo>  <mi>μ</mi>  <mspace width="0.5em" />  <mtext>mg</mtext>  <mspace width="0.5em" />  <mover accent="true">          <mtext>i</mtext>        <mo>^</mo>  </mover>  <mspace width="0.5em" />  <mtext>before collision and</mtext>  <mspace width="0.5em" />  <mi>f</mi><mo>⁡</mo>  <mo>=</mo>  <mi>μ</mi>  <mspace width="0.5em" />  <mtext>mg</mtext>  <mspace width="0.5em" />  <mover accent="true">        <mrow>          <mi>i</mi><mo>⁡</mo>        </mrow>        <mo>^</mo>  </mover>  <mspace width="0.5em" />  <mtext>after collision</mtext></mrow></math>

<math> <mrow> <mi></mi><mi>f</mi><mo>⁡</mo> <mo>=</mo> <mn>0</mn> <mspace width="0.5em"></mspace> <mtext>before collision and</mtext> <mspace width="0.5em"></mspace> <mi></mi><mi>f</mi><mo>⁡</mo> <mo>=</mo> <mo>+</mo> <mi>μ</mi> <mspace width="0.5em"></mspace> <mtext>mg</mtext> <mspace width="0.5em"></mspace> <mover accent="true"> <mrow> <mi></mi><mi>i</mi><mo>⁡</mo> </mrow> <mo>^</mo> </mover> <mspace width="0.5em"></mspace> <mtext>after collision</mtext> </mrow> </math>

<math> <mrow> <mi></mi><mi>f</mi><mo>⁡</mo> <mo><</mo> <mo>μ </mo><mtext>mg</mtext> <mspace width="0.5em"></mspace> <mover accent="true"> <mrow> <mi mathvariant="normal"></mi><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mo>⁡</mo> </mrow> <mo>^</mo> </mover> <mspace width="0.5em"></mspace> <mtext>before collision and</mtext> <mspace width="0.5em"></mspace> <mi></mi><mi>f</mi><mo>⁡</mo> <mo>=</mo> <mi>μ</mi> <mspace width="0.5em"></mspace> <mtext>mg</mtext> <mspace width="0.5em"></mspace> <mover accent="true"> <mrow> <mi></mi><mi>i</mi><mo>⁡</mo> </mrow> <mo>^</mo> </mover> <mspace width="0.5em"></mspace> <mtext>just after collision</mtext> </mrow> </math>

<math><mrow>  <mi>f</mi><mo>⁡</mo>  <mo>=</mo>  <mi>μ</mi>  <mspace width="0.5em" />  <mtext>mg</mtext>  <mspace width="0.5em" />  <mtext>before collision and</mtext>  <mspace width="0.5em" />  <mtext>just after collision</mtext></mrow></math>

solution.text:
Before collision, pure uniform rolling therefore f = 0 After collision, point P is having net velocity along –x axis, Therefore f = + μ mg

∴                f⁡ = 0 before collision and f⁡ = + μ mg i⁡ ^ after collision
